expected_issues.description: Non-selective beta-blocker (Propranolol) in patient with asthma - bronchospasm risk
expected_issues.reasoning: Non-selective beta-blockers like propranolol block beta-2 receptors in bronchial smooth muscle, causing bronchoconstriction. Absolutely contraindicated in asthma patients - can trigger severe, potentially fatal bronchospasm. Patient already has aspirin-induced bronchospasm history, indicating hyperreactive airways. If beta-blocker needed, must use cardioselective agent (metoprolol, atenolol) at lowest dose.
